page.title: 16MOOR ROW - THE VILLAGE
page.content:
Moor Row is a very quiet village of very little but housing. It is rather a dowdy and unpicturesque place. Housing is typical of the area - no gardens - front or back - two bedroomed stone terraces. There are few garages so the streets are full of parked cars.
There is a strong objection from Moor Row residents to the caravan site near the disused station. It has not got planning permission, and indeed has been ordered to cease operating by the council, but its owners carry on letting the caravans. As fast as the council rehouse people from the caravans, the owners put more people in, who then say they have nowhere else to live, and need rehousing! Local people accuse them of vandalism, theft and noise, and want rid of them.
